title: Castle Inn Motel, San Francisco
review_list:

The Castle Inn is not an upscale hotel by any means, but you get more than you pay for in location, the convenience of on-site parking,...

I had outpatient surgery in SF and had to be at the surgeons office the next morning for a post surgery check up. small hotel in good location in San francisco. big clean rooms with place to sit, fridge, microwave, coffee maker, etc. bit run down but clean and comfortable. It was really nice for the price I paid, the room was nice and clean and the TV worked, however the ice machine didn't work while I was there. It close enough to the pier so you can walk, the staff gave us a map and told us how to get to china town and little Italy. And the staff...

Hesitant to write a raving review for this place for fear that it will be booked up when I need it. More  



Just stayed one night on a road trip. Got our room using Hotel Tonight. Certainly not new or fancy but great location, clean and comfortable beds. This town is one of the priciest in the US so we were thrilled! Both the night clerk and the morning clerks were exceptional. Friendly and informative- helped make our short stay perfect!

We did book this hotel for four nights. The price is not expansive, especially because you have free parking.
The rooms where big and really clean. The staff is friendly. Dont expect to much from breakfast, not much to choose from.
The hotel is good situated, we shure would stay here again.

title: Omni San Francisco Hotel
review_list:
One of the best hotel stays I've ever experienced. Extraordinary service. The Loyalty Ambassador is exquisite - Debora Tjandra - and she will go the extra mile to make sure your stay is memorable. Highly recommended!

The Omni Hotel in San Francisco is conveniently located to business, financial and tourist areas and within walking distant to much of what we wanted to do. The hotel is extremely nice, clean, and the staff are all wonderfully friendly and helpful. Rooms are fantastic. We had a wonderful experience.

What wonderful service shown to us by the staff of The Omni We needed to make a call about the warmth of the room someone was there within five minutes. It seems that the window was a jar. Our fridge would not unlock someone brought in another to use. Ask for directions and everyone we spoke with gave good information....


More  



I loved this hotel! The rooms are very spacious and clean. The bathroom as well is very spacious. The rooms have lots of privacy and you cannot hear your neighbors at all. It is conveniently located on California St where you can catch the trolley back from shopping at Market St.

Wonderful and enjoyable stay at the Omni San Francisco. Loved the location and the ability to be able to walk to great restaurants and China town. The Bart was walking distance as well. Will definitely return and stay here. The amenities were comfortable and our room was spacious. Our room was rather quiet even being in the city.

I love this understated hotel in the financial district. Good size rooms, amazing staff, and a reasonable price (for San Francisco). Desk clerks, bellboys and valets all went above and beyond the call of duty to make us feel welcome. Central location to Chinatown, Nob Hill, Embarcadero, and North Beach.

I was billed $51 for valet parking, even though I had reserved with the Trip Advisor special with free parking. I called the hotel, and the clerk acted as if she couldn't see this on my confirmation. It was clearly on MY confirmation, which I emailed her, and she still wouldn't admit it was on my reservation, or agree to...


More  



First stay at an Omni property, absolutely wonderful service, amenities and food. Great location and top notch employees. Did not spend a lot of time in the room, but enjoyed the lobby and Bobs Chop house for diner and breakfast. I would definitely recommend this hotel and return

Very impressed with this Hotel and it's service and employees! From the moment we arrived until we left, we encountered a friendly, efficient and helpful staff. Location was great and the room was very comfortable.

Excellent from start to finish. Clearly well managed hotel. Best four star I've stayed at in along time.
Recently stayed three nights.
I'll start with the first thing everyone wants to know when checking Trip Advisor...how's the housekeeping? Clean and well maintained with old world charm. Loved the spacious, traditional style rooms (albeit with an aggressive carpet pattern!). Desktop space...


More

Excellent room corner room in the modern tower windows 365 view on SF

Thank you Fairmont for making my birthday celebration fabulous! The view from our room was amazing!! The location is ideal. Near China town, business district and fishermans wharf. Great way to wake up in the city by the bay...

I love the room they gave me and all the services provided. I definitely will stayin that facility again. It's very convenient to everything. I also love to walk and go to St Mary's Cathedral an to China town

We like staying at this hotel as it is in more of a quiet neighbourhood but still within walking distance of so many things in the city. The beds are outstanding and the decor and cleanliness of the rooms are excellent. Checkin is easy, friendly. The lobby is gorgeous.

title: Argonaut Hotel, San Francisco
review_list:
We had a nice room, a little pricey but the location was outstanding. Cost way too much to park at $50 a night plus tax. Everyone was very nice, I left a really nice hat in the room and they are sending to me now, was just happy they turned it in, they offered to ship to me, not free,...

We were really surprised with the size of the room, we had the Bayview Spa suite which was bigger than most apartments. If you are hungry you can either go to the restaurant the Blue Mermaid downstairs or walk half a block...


More  



I came for 6 days with my husband before the Super Bowl. The location on the wharf could not be beat. We were able to walk all over the wharf, grab a trolley or streetcar To Go to places all over the city, or just grabbing Uber from the front of the hotel. We had a king Deluxe room with...


More  



Excellent location right on the pier of San Francisco. Close to restaurants, shops, cafes and everything, walking. Premium interiors with naval charm - just look at the room! Definitely worth the money

Perfect hotel. Stayed here last March. Perfect location on Fishermans Wharf. Beautiful trendy, clean rooms with lovely beds and bathrooms. Lovely building with bay and bridge views. Nice restaurant and wine bar attached.
Cannot fault this hotel, I'd like to stay here again, budget allowing, it's a little pricey!

They say location is everything, the Argonaut is just in front of the Bay Area. Nice deco, small rooms though. Beware of the pricey parking fees and plan for dinner in advance as you will only find food until 10pm in most restaurants in the area.
Cable cart and the famous Irish Coffee house are just around the corner.

I really enjoyed this hotel. It's family friendly. The employees are really nice and helpful. They tell you are about amazing cool local restaurants. It's close to everything. The trolley is across the street. The pier where you are see Alcatraz is right across the street. There is a Ben & Jerry's right next to the hotel. Parking is pricey...


More  



I stayed here for my first trip to San Francisco and it was everything we wanted from a hotel. It had lovely big rooms, right next to all the restaurants and attractions of Fisherman's Wharf. The service at this hotel was from the moment we drove our car to the front door, checked in and any service we required. The room had beautiful decor in a nautical theme. I cannot comment on the restaurant because I never had any meals here other than stopping in one evening at the bar for a drink.

We stayed here during the week before Christmas and chose this spot as it was close to all the great tourist spots around town. The room is comfortable, the restaurant delicious and the staff friendly.

title: Chancellor Hotel on Union Square, San Francisco

Rooms are clean and comfortable. Staff goes beyond the call of duty. The location can't be beat. It's my SF destination hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel for friends and family. Union Square is a great place to be.

Stayed here for 4 days in January and thought it was great. Fantastic location, everything at your doorstep, including the trolly car. Rooms are small but very comfortable and clean. Staff were so pleasant, nothing was too much trouble. Would definitely recommend to others.

Great location in the heart of Downtown San Fran and across the road from Union Square. Stayed one night at The Chancellor in January. Staff was over the top, the room was clean, the bed was super comfortable, and the location was perfect for me. I loved the uniqueness of the hotel and its comfortable environment. Bang for your buck this is an excellent choice!

This is our favorite place in SF.
Its clean, updated, and the staff are great, the trolly car is just out the door and so is Union Square. Its a good up hill hike from the BARTso don't bring to many bags

The positive reviews on this hotel are all correct. The staff is very accommodating and the location is fantastic. The rooms are small but well appointed, and the bed, pillows and linens are quite nice. They do not have AC but in SF that is usually not a problem.

The St Francis is a famous landmark in the union square area. You get all the modern convienceses of a modern hotel within an old world package. You can't beat walking out your front doors onto both the Powell and Mason cable car lines! Great desk staff!

I stayed at this hotel attending a 3 day conference. The conference facilities were very good and the wifi worked well for me. The rooms and corridors now look dated rather than historic. The room size was good, and the bars in the lobby had a good atmosphere to stop for a late drink.

The walls are paper thin...

My son & I stayed for one night. Mildly disappointed that parking was not included ($10) but it's better than street parking.
Rooms were clean. Surprised us with a small pool! It was clean & refreshing.
Close to AT&T park. We simply took Uber for the baseball game.
Left too early for complimentary continental breakfast, so no opinion on that....

We stayed there during Dreamforce and extend it for couple days.
Why stressful? Because someone was knocking to my and my friends door at 2:30am and it wasn't room service. I'm not so brave to open doors only observed through window (our rooms was on ground floor and was reachable from parking)
Rooms are clean and big.
Location is ok...

We stayed in this hotel during a business trip, where we spent all day out in the city and only slept there for a few hours. For this purpose it was absolutely fine, but they charged an extra amount for parking and we never knew what the other 50USD was...
The breakfast was not really colorful, but it was ok.
